aboutMe.title: About Me
aboutMe.name: Ali
aboutMe.smallBreif: , a Computer Engineer from Sudan who graduated from University of Gazira in 2025.
aboutMe.aboutTech: My passion for technology started in childhood around 2008-2010 through activities like gaming, browsing the internet, and using platforms like Facebook & G9G . What began as simple fun sparked a deep interest in how technology works, which solidified by high school into a desire to pursue a computer-related field of study.

technology.title: With Technology:
technology.text: My passion for technology began in my childhood, around 2008. I was fascinated by computers and spent many hours playing video games and browsing the internet. I enjoyed watching YouTube videos and talking to friends on social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter. At the time, it felt like fun‚Äîbut in reality, it started a deep interest in how technology works. By the time I reached high school, I knew I wanted to study something related to computers.

university.title: University & High School:
university.text: In 2017, I took a big step and joined the University of Gezira, Faculty of Engineering and Technology, where I studied Computer Engineering. I started learning programming in high school, when we were taught the basics of Pascal and binary systems. Then in 2018, I wrote my first real lines of code using C++. Seeing the result of something I created was exciting‚Äîit confirmed that this is what I wanted to do.

love.title: Falling in love with UI & Linux:
love.text: In 2021, I discovered my real passion: building user interfaces. I realized I enjoy creating things people can actually see and use‚Äîdesigning layouts, building clean components, and making smooth user experiences. That same year, I switched from Windows to Linux, which made me more focused and comfortable while coding.

paragraphs.before: My journey into frontend development began in mid-2022, when I started learning HTML and CSS through YouTube ‚Äî special thanks to
paragraphs.after: . I started to understand design consistency and core layout concepts like Flexbox, Grid, and responsive design.

paragraphs.before: Over time, I focused on improving my CSS skills even further. I learned Sass and Tailwind CSS, which helped me build modern and scalable UIs much faster.
Once I had a solid foundation in HTML and CSS, I moved on to learning JavaScript. I practiced through
paragraphs.after: , which helped me grow my skills using real-world designs.

paragraphs.before: I deepened my CSS knowledge through amazing channels like
paragraphs.after: and blogs such as CSS-Tricks and Ahmed Shadeed‚Äôs blog.

paragraphs.before: In 2024, I began learning React.js from
paragraphs.after: , which opened up a new world of reusable and scalable UI development.

paragraphs.before: Throughout this journey, I‚Äôve built many projects that helped me grow as a frontend developer and improve my design, performance, and UX skills.
